questions.question 1: If the temperature difference across the liquid layer was increased, how would it affect the rate of heat transfer?

questions.question 2: During your experiment, if the thickness of the liquid layer was doubled, what would happen to the thermal conductivity value (assuming ideal conditions)?

questions.question 3: Which one of the following could be a possible reason for errors in your measured thermal conductivity?)?

questions.question 4: If your calculated thermal conductivity value is significantly lower than the standard value, what could be a likely cause?

questions.question 5: What conclusion can you draw if the thermal conductivity value remains constant after repeating the experiment multiple times under the same conditions?

answers.b: The thermal conductivity of liquid is not measurable
answers.c: The experimental setup is consistent and reliable
answers.d: The liquid has no heat transfer capability
